The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus or Tomb of Mausolus was a tomb built between 
353 and 350 BC at Halicarnassus (present Bodrum, Turkey) for Mausolus, a 
satrap in the Persian Empire, and his sister-wife Artemisia II of Caria. The 
structure was designed by the Greek architects Satyros and Pythius of ... In 353 
BC, Mausolus died, leaving Artemisia to rule alone.
